words.definition: Aggregate is the total number or amount for a group of things.
words.example: The aggregate of all the scores was quite high.

words.definition: An antibiotic is a drug used to kill bacteria and cure infections.
words.example: The doctor prescribed an antibiotic for her ear infection.

words.definition: A circuit is a path for an electrical current to flow around.
words.example: The technician fixed the broken circuit in the television.

words.definition: To complement something means to make it better or more complete.
words.example: The red tie complements your blue suit perfectly.

words.definition: To compress something means to press it together so that it takes up less space.
words.example: He compressed the trash into a small bale.

words.definition: A database is a collection of information that is stored in a computer.
words.example: The company has a database of all its customers.

words.definition: If one thing is the equivalent of another, it is the same in value or amount.
words.example: Ten dollars is the equivalent of about eight euros.

words.definition: When you are immune to a disease, your body can protect itself from it.
words.example: After getting the vaccine, she was immune to the virus.

words.definition: Input is information that is put into a computer or a discussion.
words.example: The system needs some user input to start the process.

words.definition: When two people are intimate, they are very close friends or relatives.
words.example: They shared an intimate conversation over dinner.

words.definition: A magnet is an object that can attract iron and steel.
words.example: He used a magnet to pick up the paperclips.

words.definition: Metabolism is the process by which a living thing changes food into energy.
words.example: Exercise can help speed up your metabolism.

words.definition: A microchip is a very small part of a computer that stores information.
words.example: The microchip allows the computer to process data quickly.

words.definition: A phase is a stage in a process or development.
words.example: The construction project is in its final phase.

words.definition: To pinch someone means to press their skin between your thumb and finger.
words.example: She pinched her arm to make sure she wasn't dreaming.

words.definition: When something is prevalent, it is common in a particular place or time.
words.example: Flu is very prevalent during the winter months.

words.definition: Quantum relates to the very small parts that make up all matter and energy.
words.example: Quantum physics is a difficult subject for many students.

words.definition: A ratio is a relationship between two amounts that shows how much bigger one is.
words.example: The ratio of students to teachers in the school is twenty to one.

words.definition: A spiral is a shape that goes around a central point and gets further away.
words.example: The stairs went up in a spiral to the top of the tower.

words.definition: When something is viral, it is caused by or relates to a virus.
words.example: The doctor said her sore throat was a viral infection.
